summary: Y’know, I feel like Nott’s taking less and less sips of her alcohol before doing anything risky. She used to do it before...
body: Y’know, I feel like Nott’s taking less and less sips of her alcohol before doing anything risky. She used to do it before anything shifty, but now does it much more infrequently. Potentially it could be Sam forgetting to do it, but I prefer to think that it’s character building for Nott.

reblog.comment: Y’know, I feel like Nott’s taking less and less sips of her alcohol before doing anything risky. She used to do it before anything shifty, but now does it much more infrequently. Potentially it could be Sam forgetting to do it, but I prefer to think that it’s character building for Nott.

Potentially it could be Sam forgetting to do it, but I prefer to think that it’s character building for Nott.

blog.name: night-filled-mountain
blog.description:
“Each atom of that stone, each mineral flake of that night-filled mountain, in itself forms a world. The struggle itself toward the heights is enough to fill a man's heart. One must imagine Sisyphus happy.”

-Albert Camus, “The Myth of Sisyphus”

summary: I know others have already said this, but “I have recently been putting my hands where they don’t belong” is such a flawless...
body:
I know others have already said this, but “I have recently been putting my hands where they don’t belong” is such a flawless description of Fjord’s entire arc, like…what a masterful line.

He touched the first sphere. Avantika’s letter. The stolen pirate ship. Avantika herself. The second sphere. The blood altar. The puzzle box (yes, that was Caleb, but Fjord was actively encouraging further exploration). The ruby in the stain-glass window. And while I wait for tomorrow’s episode, it’s just making me obsess over the other super relevant Travis line last week: “Have I learned anything?????”

reblog.comment:

summary: your eyes look like coming home - Imestelomel - Critical Role (Web Series) [Archive of Our Own]
title: your eyes look like coming home - Imestelomel - Critical Role (Web Series) [Archive of Our Own]
excerpt: An Archive of Our Own, a project of the Organization for Transformative Works
description:
Chapters: 1/1
Fandom: Critical Role (Web Series)
Rating: General Audiences
Warnings: No Archive Warnings Apply
Relationships: Mollymauk Tealeaf/Caleb Widogast
Characters: Mollymauk Tealeaf, Caleb Widogast, Nott (Critical Role), Beauregard (Critical Role), Keg (Critical Role), Nila (Critical Role), Caduceus Clay, The Mighty Nein
Additional Tags: Alternate Universe - Canon Divergence, Alpha/Beta/Omega Dynamics, Alpha Caleb Widogast, Omega Mollymauk Tealeaf, Nonbinary Mollymauk Tealeaf, Male Pronouns for Mollymauk, Post-Battle, Battle Recovery, Protective Nott (Critical Role), Gay Disaster Beauregard (Critical Role), Nesting
Series: Part 2 of we breathe, we dream, we raise our love
Summary:

“Mollymauk stared into the fire, absentmindedly prodding at the bite at his neck with gentle fingers. They had done it. They had, with the help of some new friends, saved everyone. He had been unbelievably proud as Caleb had landed that killing blow on Lorenzo, flames spiraling from his fingers as Molly had crouched carefully above him on the stairs. He had been a little terrified at the time, with the alpha bleeding everywhere and still insisting on protecting his equally injured omega like he was fresh to the fight, but the entire night had also reassured him down to his bones that Caleb had been the right choice to bond with after all.”

summary: I’m still astounded that sam plays like wait what does my ability do, I never use this basic aspect of my class, do I have to...
body:
I’m still astounded that sam plays like wait what does my ability do, I never use this basic aspect of my class, do I have to roll all these dice? until it really matters for someone’s life and then he’s suddenly mr. knows how many hp everyone has and how many reactions are in play and where everyone is on the map

@kymal had this tag that’s been in my head this week that was like sam was born to play support characters and like, fuckin yeah.

summary: You know what I really want? Canon birthdays for the M9, and I don’t mean like years, just the day they where born.  They have...
body:
You know what I really want? Canon birthdays for the M9, and I don’t mean like years, just the day they where born. 

They have been traveling for almost 4 month now so at least some of them must have had their brithday during that time, right? 
Did they celebrate with the others? Or something else? I just want to know!

I mean Matt has an entire calendar system in the campagin guide, it’s a shame that it’s not being put to use

summary: Re-watching the library scene is fascinating because there is so much pressure being put on Caleb with regard to those books....
body:
Re-watching the library scene is fascinating because there is so much pressure being put on Caleb with regard to those books. Matt keeps bringing them up, even making Liam roll a perception check and notice that they’re spell books; Caduceus has Twiggy trying to break into them explicitly for Caleb; Nott, of course, stalls him in that room as long as she possibly can, frantically trying to break into one book after another; and yet Caleb, the entire time, is more desperately and determinedly laser-focused on finding Fjord than anyone else in the group.

He’s tempted by the books. He’s visibly tempted. He fidgets, closes his eyes, gives in just a little bit, and ultimately screams at Nott because the effort to resist that temptation is literally torture to him. And still he jumps through that window.

I don’t know all the factors in Caleb’s obvious distress at the end of the episode, and I don’t know what this week will bring, but it’s never been clearer that if Caleb’s plan is “Gain the power and knowledge to accomplish my Ultimate Goal, and don’t get attached to anyone along the way,” he has, uh…gotten off-track.

tags: I really loved hearing Matt talk about the characters so I'm transcribing my favorite bits for future reference
summary: Matt: “I love watching characters be put in situations where they have to choose between their long-reaching character goals, or...
body:
Matt: “I love watching characters be put in situations where they have to choose between their long-reaching character goals, or intended character goals, and the safety of the people they’ve come to take as their family. And I think this episode had a few moments like that, where Caleb has been so obsessed, I mean he’s spent - every town he’s like ‘where’s the books??’”

Sam: “Not every town, every room!”

Matt: “That’s true.”

Sam: “‘You enter a cave-’ ‘Are there any books??’ ‘No you’re in a cave.’”

Matt: “And the whole room was meant to be a room to be explored, with all sorts of positive and negative things attached to that exploration. But as soon as Fjord pushed that button it put a timer on it. And I was like ‘Oh, how’s this gonna go?’ And the more time that was spent I’m just sitting there, like, ticking away on my sheet, like, ‘How much longer are they going to be behind the rest of the group?’ It got really intense and I was fascinated to see that struggle. And I was actually really proud of both of them, only taking the time they did. And I’m genuinely really excited to see what happens this Thursday. There was so much emotional tension and there was so much fear…I dunno, the dynamics this week are gonna make for some really interesting roleplay this week. I’m excited.
